main event: A civilian observer in Albuquerque, New Mexico reported seeing a single round, penny-sized, white object in the sky on July 24, 1961 at 21:42.
interesting points: The object moved slowly and smoothly at a steady rate, in a visual sighting from east to west behind trees.
The observation lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
The observer was an elderly civilian, with their daughter also sighting the same object.
The weather conditions were clear with light and variable winds.
A balloon release from Kirtland AFB was reported in the area around the same time, but the investigating officer could not make a conclusive determination due to the late submission of the report.
